reg.title: Public Place Sanitary Facilities Regulation
reg.amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B. C. Reg. 181/88]

definition.def: means a public place of assembly or recreation and includes an amusement park, an arena, a campsite, a church, a community hall and a developed beach, but does not include a neighbourhood park, a school ground or a refreshment stand;
means a room containing a toilet, washbasin and ancillary equipment and includes a privy, shower or urinal.

section.marginalnote: Access to sanitary facility in public place
section.sectiontext: No person shall operate or cause to be operated a public place unless it contains adequate sanitary facilities to which the public has access.

No person shall permit the public access to a sanitary facility that is provided by that person for use by the public under section 2 or otherwise unless that facility is maintained so as to prevent a health hazard condition arising.

content.provisionsnote: [Provisions of the Public Health Act, S.B.C. 2008, c. 28, relevant to the enactment of this regulation: section 115]
